title: Swashy historical script with a killer "w"
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/086547978X_6671.jpg)

 [‹ BERNARDO SOARES - What type is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42610 "Go to previous forum topic") [Credits etc. in documentary No End In Sight ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42599 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content: If you’d like this style of type with a clean outline, there is [LTC Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/lanston_type/ltc_caslon_swash_long/?sample_text=Spring%20Awakening&sample_size=48) and [Adobe Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/adobe_caslon_pro_italic_ot/?sample_text=Spring%20Awakening&sample_size=48) (see Swash characters).
and what is the font “FRANK WEDEKIND” and “JONATHAN FRANZEN” is set in?

It’s a little small, but it looks like [Rockwell Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040325/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/rockwell_condensed/?sample_text=FRANK%20WEDEKIND&sample_size=60).
